Title: My return trip was - out on Monday and back on Friday! A seamless flight which kept time during both legs, overseen by efficient, courteous staff. The snacks were fresh. Title: The 10.30 flight to Kruger International airport in South Africa could not take off due to a technical error on plane. A plane and crew were miraculously found approx. 90 mins later (around 12 noon). The light I was booked on at 1 pm to go from Vic Falls to Johannesburg was then reported to have a technical fault at 12.50 pm. That’s two technical faults on two planes … unless you hypothesise that they sent to 1 pm plane bound to Johannesburg to Kruger instead, but that would mean passengers were not told the truth. Ended up leaving Victoria Falls on another plane at 14.10 - almost missed my connecting flight from Johannesburg to Australia. My luggage didn’t make it as Fastjet unable to book luggage through to final destination. Will not be using this company again.

Title: So  I was  booked to  fly from  Johannesburg  to  Harare  on 3  August  2022  at  15.15. I had  purchased the ticket  through Flight  Centre  Rosebank. Today, 4  august, I’m  still in Johannesburg  with no  idea  when or  whether  I will ever  fly on that ticket. I presented myself  at  the Fastjet  checkin  counter  over  2  and  a half  hours  before  departure. I presented to  them  my valid  passport  and  negative  covid test  result, which test  had  been done on 2 August. To  my horror, I was  informed that  I wasn’t  booked on the flight  and  should consult  with the Fastjet  reservation office  which was  conveniently located directly behind  the check initial reception was  courteous. The gentlemen manning  the counter  checked my ticket  and  informed me that  inin  counters. My their  system my ticket  had  been cancelled. I  called  Flight  Centre  Rosebank who  immediately spoke to  the Fastjet folks. I guess  I should note  that  the Fastjet  counter  is  manned by Menzies  staff  who  provide services to  Fastjet. Obviously, the intricacies  of these  relationships  are  lost  on me. As  far  as  I was  concerned I was  dealing  with Fastjet. The conversations  between Fastjet  and  Flight  Centre  Rosebank continued until  boarding  closed and the plane  departed. As  I don’t  live  in  Johannesburg, my next  concer n was  accommodation food and transport  to  get  to  the accommodation.  Around  5pm, I communicated again with Flight  Centre Rosebank who  informed me that  at  that  point  it  was  unlikely that  I would fly that  day, notwithstanding  the fact  that  there  was  a Fastjet flight  leaving  for  Harare  after  6  pm. I shared my concerns  re  accommodation etc  with accommodation etc. They advised that  I check into  a hotel and retain all my receipts. In  the aftermath of  this  mess  they would seek reimbursement  from  Fastjet. Thus, my search for  a hotel began. City Lodge  OR Tambo  and  InterContinental  OR Tambo  were  both fully booked. I  proceeded to  the shuttle parking  lot  and  eventually managed shuttle driver  from  Birchwood Hotel and Conference  centre  to  book the last with the help  of  a room  they had. Note that  the search for  a hotel room  involved walking  around  the airport  for  more  than two  hours dragging  behind  my 30kgs  of  luggage. I woke up this  morning  4  August  uncertain.  Everything  about  this  trip  is  now  uncertain.  By  9.30am  I had spoken to  Flight  Centre  Rosebank who  were  commencing  the second  round in the battle with Fastjet  to  secure  me  a seat  for  a flight  I booked and paid  for  more  than a week ago. I’m  sitting  at  the BC  Café  at  the Birchwood Hotel and Conference  Centre  watching  f lights  landing  at  departing  from OR Tambo. I think its  been over  48  hours  since  I took my  covid test  so  it  may no  longer  be valid  for entry into  Zimbabwe. In  the event  that  Fastjet  succeeds  in  securing  a seat  for  me today, I will  have the worry of  the Covi d test where  to  get  one done. I noticed that  the Dischem  covid testing  station in  OR Tambo  has  been dismantled. I have  kept  receipts  for  the hotel and for  a early dinner  I  had yesterday. While  Flight  Centre Rosebank may fight for  a reimbursement  of  thes e  expenses Fastjet  may refuse  any such request. I got a call from Flight Centre Rosebank notifying me to get to the airport cos i had been waitlisted for the 6pm flight. I took the hotel shuttle and  endured a long wait before being checked in. Fast forward to a couple of hours later.  We landed in Harare to find most of our luggage had been left in joburg. There was much wailing among the passengers some of whom were attending weddings early the next day. Judging by the rows of luggage arranged in different groupings,  i guess, indicating different flights, leaving luggage was the norm. So on 5 August, I went back to the Harare airport at 5pm to collect my luggage.  So what is supposed to be a 1.40 minute flight between Johannesburg and Harare turned out to be a saga starting on 3 August and ending on 5 August. And Fastjet believes I was not sufficiently inconvenienced.  Gonahs@gmail.com

Title: I was extremely hesitant to use this airline because of all the negative reviews.  However, it was the best option I could find for a flight to Vic Falls, so I booked through a third party who guarantees flights, and purchased flight insurance.  These precautions proved to be completely unnecessary.  I had a positive experience using this airline.  You simply need to read the airline's policies carefully and follow them.First, they state clearly that your flight time may change.  They also state that if the incoming flight arrives early, your flight may leave early.  So, I started checking the flight updates the evening before to make sure there were no changes.  I also showed up at the airport early, when check-in opened, which was over an hour early.Yes, this required some effort and some additional time spent in some very boring airports, but I made both my outgoing and return flight with absolutely no issues.The staff is friendly and helpful.  The flight was uneventful, and they serve a decent snack of two different pastries and a bottle of water.The plane was older (think ashtrays in the armrests!), but clean and appeared to be well-maintained.I think you need to remember that people are often more likely to write a negative review than a positive one.  So, the reviews you read may not accurately reflect the majority of customers of Fast Jet.  Overall, I would definitely recommend using the airline for hops between Harare and Vic Falls.
xcjrc: This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews.

Title:
On December 23, 2018, at 3:30 p.m., my family (husband and two children) and I got to Victoria Falls International Airport (“VFA”) to get Fastjet flight number 8004 to Johannesburg (“JNB”), that was supposed to departure at 17:40p.m. on that day, as per the confirmation we received from FastJet booking number YVTY1S by e-mail on March 18, 2018.

Arriving at VFA we went to Fastjet counter and we, for our surprise, were informed that such flight had already taken off at 10:30a.m. that day. And worse, there were no other flights from VFA to JNB on December 23, 2018!!

So we were stuck at VFA with no place to go for that night.

Please note that we have not received any e-mail from FastJet warning or informing us about the change of the flight.

We went to Fastjet’s ground crew office at VFA to try to find information and help and after several hours talking to them and with them on the phone with their supervisor we were informed that there was nothing FastJet could do to help us!!! It was so unbelievable!!!! I could not believe that FastJet would leave my family and I completally unattended in the middle of Africa!!! They did not even booked us on the next flight that was on the followinf day!

So we had to arrange and pay for transportation (taxi), accommodation, food and another four flight tickets for the next day to JNB.

They did it because Fastjet is an African company and as we are foreigner and we would not be able to sue them.

Title: Be warned fellow travellers thinking of using Fast Jet. I made an advance online booking with Fastjet because it offered a mid-morning flight at a convenient time on the date I wished to travel. Fastjet cancelled the flight and then informed me I needed to buy another (full-price) ticket. Yes folks. Their policy is is they cancel, you can pay for a new ticket. When I protested, Fast jet offered me a flight leaving at 6;30 am. This was not convenient, and they repeated that my options were, take this flight or buy a new ticket. After the exchange of many messages, my travel agent won an agreement from Fastjet that I could book a later flight on the same date, with no extra fees for the change of bookings. However when I arrived at Dar es Salaam to board my flight, I was informed that I must pay booking fees first. The booking fees were almost exactly the same price as new ticket. The booking clerk was incredibly rude and unhelpful. When asked for a receipt the clerk replied that Fastjet policy was not to give receipts. When pressed to supply proof of payment the clerk became belligerent. I boarded, after paying the fees. To make things worse, the plane sat on the runway for an hour after departure time, due to technical difficulties Fastjet was experiencing. So be warned. If you really need to use this airline, I suggest you book and fly immediately. I urge fellow travellers to boycott this airline until they change their policy. There are other, more reputable airlines, that fly the same routes. To date my travel agent has not been able to get a refund for the extra fees, even though she has proof from Fastjet that they were not going to charge them.

Title:
Two of our volunteers booked through Opodo from Manchester to Mwanza.
The first two flights were with Emirates and then the last flight was with Fastjet.
On arrival at Dar Fastjet said they had not paid even though they had the complete booking form and e-ticket with them. They said they would have to pay again and when they agreed they said their card machine was not working so they would have to pay cash. An official from fast jet accompanied them to a cash machine but the amount they could draw was limited and the limit was not enough to pay for the tickets.
They were eventually allowed on the plane owing a small balance. When they landed at Mwanza they were not allowed off the plane until they had paid the balance which they managed to do with other currencies. They arrive back in Manchester next week and will be asking OPODO what went wrong. Has anyone else had this experience and do you think they could claim any compensation and is so how would they go about it.

Title:

Title:
Yes, the tickets prices are cheap, but it's not worth the extra time, money, and hassle. I booked a round trip flight from Dar to Kilimanjaro and never stepped foot on a FastJet plane because both flights were cancelled! They did not inform us on the cancellation via email or text. We found out when we got to the airport (thankfully we arrived super early), and a random airport worker asked us which flight we were on. We were informed that "oh, FastJet usually cancel flights. You should check with the desk to see if it's still going." It was not. We were then put on a Precision Air flight that was scheduled to leave an hour later than the original FastJet. Thankfully we got a seat on the Precision flight, but many of the other FastJet customers did not. Okay, part one of the FastJet wasn't *too* bad. But now buckle up for part two.

On the return trip to Dar, we drove 1.5 hour to JRO from Arusha. We arrived at the airport 2.5 hours early (just to be safe again). Surprise, surprise, we found out that--even though we had a booked and PAID for seats on the flight--we were kicked off the flight...along with 20 other customers who also booked and paid for seats. Apparently, FastJet cancelled a flight the day before and booked all those passengers on our flight. Again, there was *zero* communication regarding this update. Unfortunately, all the other airlines were either full or charging way too much (~$350 USD for a one-way ticket from JRO-->DAR, which is one-hour flight) for a ticket. FastJet's solution? Put on us the same flight tomorrow. After complaints from many other upset customers, FastJet finally gave everyone some accommodation and transportation money to make up for their error. This wasn't possible for us since we needed to be in Dar that evening. We later found out that FastJet was lying about the flight, and it was actually cancelled. We ended up driving 1.5 hour back to Arusha and went straight to the FastJet offices and asked for refund. They said they would issue a refund (but demanded us to give back the transportation money they originally gave us...). She said we should see the refund within 10-15 business days. It has been a whole month and we have yet to see any refund. We ended up getting a flight from Arusha airport with FlightConnection and it cost around $160 USD since it was so last minute.

TLDR: Don't book with FastJet. They have a reputation of cancelling flights and not refunding their customers. Not sure how that's legal, but that's the case. I recommend booking with Precision Air or Air Tanzania instead.
dmrsr: Dar es Salaam - Kilimanjaro National Park
qwuub: Don't book with FastJet (unless you want ALL your flights cancelled...)

Title:
We had a flight booked from Kilimanjaro to Dar Es Salaam at 1.45pm. It was cancelled and we were put on a later flight that day. Then that flight was cancelled and we were put on a 6pm flight. We were told this the night before our flight.
This meant we missed our ongoing flight to Zanzibar. Luckily Auric Air let us change our ongoing flight at a small cost. But the next flight was in the morning so we were stranded in Dar Es Salaam. Before our flight we called Fast Jet’s customer services and they were not helpful at all. We were told to speak to someone when we arrived at the airport in Dar. As two young girls we thought it was a terrible and dangerous decision as we were arriving in Dar late at night. Luckily, at the airport we complained and complained until they agreed to put us up in a hotel for the night. They arranged transport to the hotel and back to the airport in the morning. So they did redeem themselves. But all of this caused us a lot of stress and worry and we lost money from our ongoing flight. The customer services department should have been able to help us and organise our hotel when we originally called them.

Title:
Had a flight booked a month in advance on FastJet, set to depart at 7:30 PM. On arriving to the airport, after 8 hours of flights from Cape Town to Dar es Salaam, we were told unapologetically that the flight was cancelled and we would have to fly at 11 AM the next day.

After not taking "no" for an answer for a few hours, we eventually booked a different flligt on Air Tanzania (paid cash last minute at the airport) and are currently in the process of waiting on a refund we've been told will be issued within 7 working days. I'm not convinced, and have been calling the contact center to to try to move things forward.

We also had booked a FastJet flight later this week out of Kilimanjaro, but have now booked a 2nd flight on a different airline. FastJet says they can't refund that upcoming flight because "we don't know yet if there will be a problem; if there is a problem we will let you know, for now it's your personal decision to cancel."

I suspect FastJet often cancels the last flight of the day on the day-of if it isn't full enough.

I feel bad for other folks on our flight who didn't get to the airport five hours early and have time to make alternate arrangements. I imagine they weren't able to get FastJet to help, and so likely lost a day; hopefully didn't miss their safari!

I would highly recommend Air Tanzania for transfer from Dar to Kilimanjaro, by the way. Very friendly and efficient service; we would have been stranded without them. Seems to be just as affordable as FastJet as well.
crvsd: Daniel H wrote a review Nov 2017

Title:
I try to learn from the mistakes of others, but the prospect of a cheap, direct flight from Zimbabwe to Tanzania was too appealing.

Even though my colleagues warned me about Fastjet – frequent cancellations, poor customer service – I took a chance, deciding to book a Thanksgiving weekend roundtrip.

I'll never make that mistake again.

A few days later, I received an email informing me that both of my flights had been cancelled. The departing flight was moved until two days later and the returning flight one day. Unable to fit the changes into my schedule, I cancelled the flight.

Unlike most airlines, I couldn't make arrangements over the phone to receive my refund. Instead, I had to go into one of the airline's offices, where I was told to fill out a refund form.

"Why can't I get my cash now?" I asked. The clerk told me that the airline can only issue refunds in the manner that the ticket was purchased. Since I purchased the flight with a debit card, I could only receive a refund by having the money deposited into my checking account.

I wasn't impressed, but Africa has its share of bureaucracy. I filled out the form.

"You'll get your refund in 5-7 business days," the clerk assured me. I had my doubts.

After 10 business days without a refund, I recalled the office. "The refund is in the pipeline," the clerk said. "I will call you back."

Silence for a week.

Be careful about anything Fastjet tells you. There's a strong possibility it's not true.

After 15 business days with no calls or a refund in sight, I contacted Fastjet again. Now I'd had enough, voicing my displeasure. Later that night, I received my first return call from Fastjet in 15 days. A clerk told me that I could pick up my refund at the office. I said I'd get it that weekend.

Not quite believing the news, I called again the next day (Day 16 without a refund). The operator didn't seem to know about my refund, so I asked to speak to a supervisor. The manager said she would look into my situation and return my call.

Silence.

On Day 17 without a refund, it was obvious that Fastjet's customer service was incompetent. Instead, I managed to track down contact information for the company's CEO.

To his credit, the Fastjet CEO – Nico Bezuidenhout – actually passed along my information to the upper echelon of corporate management.

On Day 18, I received a lengthy email from the company's general manager of sales, confirming that I'd be able to pick up my cash. Still being skeptical, I asked for clarity on how to do so. I had visions of yet another clerk not knowing what I was talking about.

The next morning (Day 19 without a refund) the general manager indicated in an email that the matter was still being investigated, rather than telling me how to pick up the money.

The email said, "The internal investigation thus far is pointing towards the refund having been processed by NMB on the 12th Oct (see attached). In the meanwhile, your refund remains in question as you have indicated, and wish to have feedback provided by tomorrow. Thank you for your continued patience."

If you ever have a complaint with Fastjet, you will encounter numerous operators telling you how sorry they are for your problem and to be patient. That is all you will get – excuses, delays, and patronizing replies.

Finally, the next day, the skies cleared (Day 20 without a refund). As I'd done each morning for three weeks, I checked my bank account. My refund had suddenly appeared.

I was promised my refund would take 5-7 business days. Instead, it took 20 (27 days, if you include weekends).

When I purchased a ticket on Fastjet, I knew I was dealing with a budget airline, but even a budget airline can deliver decent customer service.

My first experience with Fastjet will be my last. The best advice I can offer potential customers is buyer beware. If you still want to risk it, be prepared for cancellations and a litany of excuses, if you ever need a refund.

Avoid the airline at all costs.
qwuub: Airline of Cancellations and Broken Promises

Secondly we were delayed almost 4 hours. 2 of which we sat on the runway. It was now 3am, very tired, hungry and thirsty travellers- I asked for a drink and was told they can't serve while we were on the ground!!! As a result of the delay we missed our pre-paid ferry to Zanzibar and had to book a flight. Already money lost! On the way back to Lusaka, some passengers in our group received an e-mail a few hours before we were supposed to take off that our flight had been postponed by 4 days! We had to book a new ticket with Kenya Airways which cost us another $400 with an 8 hour layover in Nairobi. This trip turned into a very expensive trip thanks to Fast Jet. What an unreliable airline. Either way we would have had to forfeit money at a hotel or a new airticket on a different airline. Next time we will pay the higher price for guaranteed service with Kenya airways or South African Airways to Zanzibar. No one has replied to any of our e-mails to the company which just goes to show they are an unreliable airline. Refund for the leg they cancelled is also yet to appear in my account and will definitely not off-set the amount spent on the new ticket.

Title:
I booked a flight to Dar es Salam on the 2nd of October with a return Flight on the 9th of October. We were then crossing to Zanzibar by ferry for a wedding.

On the way there the flight was delayed by 4 hours!!! We sat on the plane for more than 2 hours waiting and we were told it was because there was no cabin spray. This is not an acceptable excuse and FastJet should know as a regular operator that this is required. The delay cause us to miss the next two ferries to Zanzibar (which we had pre-paid for). In order to get to the wedding on time now we were forced to take a flight to Zanzibar.

On the way back the flight was completely canceled for 4 days!!!! And we were given no notice. No email, No phone call, No SMS, No whats app, Nothing! Yet again we were forced to make an alternate plan by flying via Kenya and waiting in Nairobi for 8 hours to get back to ensure I was able to go to work! I was still late but I was left with no alternative.

It was the worst flying experience of my life and I was disgusted at the service we were given and the additional money I was forced to spend!

Title: I have flown previously on fastjet and was excited to get a ticket during one of their sales. It was just a small laptop bag so I was a bit confused but ended up giving them the bag and checking it in. Within a few minutes, I realized I had forgot to remove my phone from the checked bag. I returned to the gate agent, asked to see my bag (I could literally see it behind the desk) and she refused to let me have it. Upon arriving in Kilimanjaro I opened my bag and my phone was gone. I attempted to report it stolen to the fastjet agent but he refused to write a report because phones are not supposed to be in checked luggage. I then contacted fastjet online support who said they could not help me unless I had a report. Fastjet has refused to take any responsibility despite the fact that one of their staff (likely from Dar) stole my phone. They wouldn't confront the staff, refund my ticket, give me any type of credit. Nothing. I couldn't even file a report. It was overall an awful experience. Fastjet refusal to take any action has been extremely frustrating. I would not suggest this airline to any frequent travelers. Also, make sure you have locks on your bags or consider not checking any luggage. Title:
I'm really dissapointed with Fastjet.

For our honeymoon, my husband and I booked a short trip from JHB to Zanzibar, from 18-23th of November. We're both very busy so we cannot take more days of or travel on other days. We booked this months in advance.

Then, last week I got the e-mail from Fastjet announcing that our returnticket has been changed from the 23th to the 20th. At this point, I was already very much disapointed (because: a 2-day honeymoon?! ... If I wanted to go away for just the weekend I would have stayed in SA) but Fastjet said it was the only option and by now, other tickets were already much more expensive so we couldn't afford anything else.

THEN this weekend I got another e-mail, saying the flight had been changed AGAIN. We would now depart on the 27th !!!!!! of November, ONE WEEK LATER! And there was not even a return ticket. This was just impossible for us, so we were forced to cancel the trip.

Unfortunately, because of such a late notice from Fastjet, we cannot cancel the hotel reservations on Zanzibar anymore, which is R3000 lost. Customer Service declined my request for a refund of the money I lost because of THEIR incompetence (which, honestley, is not even close to compensating the DISAPOINTMENT of not having the honeymoon we so much looked forward to).

So I would not recommend Fastjet to anyone; it looks like a good deal but in the end it can cost you a lot more. So please safe yourself the dissapointment.
qwuub: Our flight got changed twice on very short notice so we needed to cancel our honeymoon

Title:
I booked my wife and I onto a Fastjet flight as part of a 6 week trip around Africa starting in Ethiopia and ending in South Africa.
The main reason being that it was the only company that appears to fly direct between Zanzibar and Jo'burg
Well I say that,but thats when they don't cancel flights!!
I received an email out of the blue from them a couple of days ago providing me
with what was termed as 'an itinerary' update ?
It was a good thing that i looked at it closely as everything was the same as the
original booking confirmation, with the exception that they had changed the flight day
from the 14th December until the 18th December,4 days on !!!
I made two calls to their customer services number in Tanzania(from the UK!) to find out what was going on
After several minutes on each call that was costing plenty, I was cut off !
I finally managed to get a response from an email to their customer services department and I suggested that they might like to arrange to book me and my wife on another carrier on the 14th December,as we were meeting our family arriving from the UK in Jo'burg on the 14th and as such could not wait until the 18th to fly.
I was told that their terms and conditions stated that they are obliged to either
rebook us onto a Fastjet flight 14 days either side of the original date or part/fully
refund the amount paid to them.
I advised them that i was not very happy about that as alternative flights on 14th
December had increased quite considerably since the date I had booked with them
and if I had to re-book one of them then i will be considerably out of pocket.
That made no difference whatsoever they had cancelled my flight and had washed their hands of any responsibility.
Disgusting attitude really!
Having read the last few reviews on TripAdvisor it would seem that this is not a rare
occurrence.It indeed appears to happen very frequently.
So my advice to anyone considering booking with Fastjet is to forget it and take another flight even if this means a stop.
I have also since this happened read some very concerning things about their financial
situation.
So i just hope i get my money back!
You have been warned.

Title:
fastjet offers the only direct flight available from ZNZ to JNB. We were traveling to Zanzibar and wanted to continue to Port Elizabeth (over JNB) to do the garden route. Ergo, our entire planning was at the mercy of this flight that they offer twice per week.

Six days before the flight, already on vacation, we were informed that the flight time changed from 8:30 to 18:20. We had to book another connection flight, a hotel for the stay (because we could not continue the same day) and missed a stay in a guesthouse in PLZ.

I sent an inquiry to customer service and I was honestly surprised that they answered: they referred me to their TOS (which says they don't refund anything) and told me that they advise their passengers to use a travel insurance.

The flight itself naturally did not take off on time (it was around 30 min late) and it was not even carried out by fastjet but by a sub-contractor (star airline or similar). A woman sitting next to me payed for seats next to the emergency exit, but was seated somewhere else. The response to her complaint was: "don't blame us: we are just the subcontractor".

Also worth a look:
[google for: fastjet delays and cancellations]
Quote: Scheduled flight times may change between publication and the date of departure. fastjet do NOT guarantee flight times.

Essentially, when you book with them, they don't guarantee specific flight times. The only thing they guarantee to you is that you may be able to fly with them (or some subcontractor) at some point in time if they have not gone out of business because of bad customer service by then.

Title:
They are a budget airline, which means that you pay for baggage, food and beverages are not served on board (unless you pay for them) and there are no entertainment systems (which is to be as expected for what you pay). With that said, the airplane on both flights I took was clean, well maintained and the staff in the aircraft were polite and professional.

On the ground, my experience was unfortunately a different story. My flight from Nairobi to Dar es Salaam at 7:50 am was cancelled; I did not get their “email notice” as I was on another red eye flight from Canada. As such, I sat in the Nairobi airport from 2:00am until 6:50am waiting to check in for my flight – there was no sign at the fastjet checkin desk to notify of a flight cancellation, so it wasn’t until I went to the ticket counter that I found this out.

Due to this, I missed my connecting flight (also a fast jet flight) from Dar es Salaam to Mwanza. (FYI: When I later read the email, the subject line did not caption ‘urgent itinerary change, or flight cancellation’ which could mislead others to skip over the email; it only said please review your flight itinerary, which happened to show a different departure time... so if you do use this airline, make sure to check your email 24 in advance for confirmation or a cancellation notice).

Regardless of the flight cancellation and missing my connecting flight (because I know these things do happen), my issue with Fast Jet was with the airline’s lack of policy surrounding how to accommodate passengers in these situations and the lack of training for ground staff (i.e. ticket counter) to respond with adequate customer service.

Case in point: Since the next Fast Jet flight we could get on was 14 hours later, myself and a few other passengers requested a food voucher OR access to an airport lounge OR a hotel accommodation so we could eat and rest; I didn’t care what they were able to provide, I just did not want to sit at the terminal for 14 hours. As a frequent traveler, I know this is standard procedure for other airlines to accommodate passengers when they make a significant itinerary change -- after all, it wasn’t our fault they cancelled our flight.

The girl at the ticket booth resisted at first, stating it was our fault we did not see the email they sent notifying us to come later. It took 4 hours of going back and forth to figure out how to proceed…during this time, I had to get behind the desk to use her laptop so I could browse alternative flight options and prices for her. They decided that booking us a sooner flight out on another airline was too expensive, so eventually they did book us a hotel in Nairobi with transport (and I honestly sincerely appreciate this!!! It was a really nice hotel with lunch included)…but it took 4 hours of negotiation and 1 hour of waiting for the taxi to get to this point. By the time I got to the hotel, I only had a few hours to sleep before we got picked up again to go back.

The girl at the ticket desk had also informed me that the best plan to get my connecting flight to Mwanza re-booked would be to arrive in Dar es Salaam and go to their ticket counter. She explained that since it departed from Dar, it needed to be reissued from Dar; she also said this office was open 24 hours.

Not surprisingly, I flew into Dar at 11:30pm and the ticket office was closed. I sat on the floor of the airport until 4:00am when the Fast Jet Ticket office opened - the lady there informed me she could not reissue my ticket and I would need to purchase another one. I was trying to explain my situation so she could understand that it was not my fault I missed my connecting flight and in fact it was Fast Jet’s cancellation that caused me to miss it, but she began to yell at me.

Thankfully she sent me to talk to another woman from Swissport (Fast Jet’s ground service representatives) and she issued me another ticket (free of charge) without a second thought. The staff at the FastJet checkin and baggage drop off (who were also Swissport staff as per their uniforms) were polite and efficient; I was able to get on board the next flight without issues after this and as mentioned earlier, the flight experience was good.

I am not sure why there is such a drastic difference of conduct with the ticket counter staff, but it seems the lack of clear policy in these situations has caused no continuity of customer service on the ground. Although I am very appreciative that I had received the hotel accommodation while in Nairobi, I must admit I was disappointed that it took 5 hours to access. I was also troubled by how I was given incorrect information regarding my layover in Dar and how poorly I was treated by Dar’s ticket office agent, especially when she could see I was tired and upset. Because of this, I will probably not use Fast Jet again.

I would not recommend this airline to you if you have a connecting flight. I would only recommend Fast Jet if you are flexible with your travel plans and willing to chance that your flight could be cancelled for an extended period of time.

Title: Fantastic on-board service from a budget airline. As with budget airlines around the world, you get what you pay for, ie getting to your destination. Extras were reasonably priced, even a checked in bag when booked online. The only comment would be for ground staff to have better systems in place for processing passengers for check-in. I flew Johannesburg-Harare-Victoria Falls-Johannesburg. The check in at Johannesburg was chaotic and the staff arrived late for the check in. Harare was a little better at more organised and Victoria Falls better still. Hopefully with some small changes to check-in procedures a "Great Low Cost Airline will Prevail in Africa"

Title:
My flight to Kilimanjaro from Entebbe was delayed by 2 hours on the 16 th of January 2016 and the return flight on the 19th January was cancelled and moved to the 21st of which i was suppose to be back in UK .That meant i had to fork out more money to buy another ticket with a different airline to get me back to Entebbe on time for my next flight.

However .i emailed their customer services ,unfortunately i never got a response so i had to make an expensive phone call to demand my money back.The lovely lady was quick to apologise and assured me action would be taken to get my money back.Its now more than two weeks ,no explanation or communication and no refund .......yet.Iam guessing i will have to make another phone call to chase them.

That was my first and last to use this airline,obviously it is cheap in some way but very expensive in case of a cancellation.Infact when i saw an out of date magazine on their flight i smelt a very stinky rat,April 2014 to January 2016 ummm surely a tell tale sign. Use it at your own risk folks!!!
